title: Barden Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Richard Law / Lower Barden Reservoir from Hutchen Gill Head
images.caption: Lower Barden Reservoir from Hutchen Gill Head. In the distance, Carncliff Top across the other side of Wharfedale.

images.title: David Spencer / Far Long Gill
images.caption: Far Long Gill. The gill feeds into Lower Barden Reservoir. Seen from the bridge on the reservoir access track.

images.title: David Spencer / Bridge over Kittlety Sike
images.caption: Bridge over Kittlety Sike. This sizeable bridge takes the Upper Barden Reservoir access track over Kittlety Sike.

images.title: David Spencer / Brass Castle
images.caption: Brass Castle at the western end of the reservoir. A shooting hut decked out with benches and a table.

images.title: David Spencer / Ford across Barden Beck
images.caption: Ford across Barden Beck. The reservoir access track crosses Barden Beck

images.title: David Spencer / Sluice, Lower Barden Reservoir
images.caption: Sluice at the lower reservoir. The channel runs the entire length of the reservoir's western side.

images.title: Ian Greig / The road across the dam at Upper Barden reservoir
images.caption: The road across the dam at Upper Barden reservoir. You can reach the reservoir by following a track north west from the lower lake for just over a mile.

images.title: Tim Cook / The retaining wall and Upper Barden Reservoir
images.caption: The retaining wall and Upper Barden Reservoir

description: This walk visits the Lower Barden Reservoir on Barden Moor in the Nidderdale area of Yorkshire. You can follow a circular footpath around the reservoir which runs for about 1.5 miles. There's splendid views across the water to the surrounding moorland and hills. The walk can be extended by following footpaths north west across Barden Moor to visit Upper Barden Reservoir. Both the reservoirs date from the 19th century and feed water into the Barden Beck, which flows into the River Wharfe. You can follow footpaths along the pretty beck at the western end of the site.
